CatDescriptText: Mrs. June Cooley, 16 Gould Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?"  Answer reads: "No, I don't think so. in first place, I think that the children of today should be taken back to the time when my mother was young.  Then, a paddle was used.  I might add that child psychology does not go along with my trend of thinking."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of June Cooley wearing light colored coat with wood buttons, holding large handbag, standing on sidewalk next to store window
